bibl.title: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to Albert E. Truby, January 14, 1954

div1.p: Hench writes Truby that he believes Nogueira is making arrangements to get the Finlay Medal to Truby.

div1.head: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to Albert E. Truby, January 14, 1954
div1.opener:
January 14, 1954
General Albert E. Truby
145 Laurel Street
San Francisco 18, California
My dear General Truby:
div1.p:
There must be something in telepathy because
while I was writing to Pedro he was writing
to me about the very same thing. Apparently
Lambert was invited to Havana for December 3
and received his Finlay Medal. Pedro is now
making arrangements to have the other medals
delivered. I have sent him your letter and
will see what he has done about the matter when
I go to Cuba in about ten days.
div1.closer:
Sincerely yours, P. S. Hench, M.D. PSH: alc
P.S.: I have just received your second letter.
I don't know why I thought you were still in
the hospital. Somehow I thought Doctor Treanor
was treating you there as an in-patient. I am
delighted to know that you are at home.
